title.narrative: 1.2 EARLY CHILDHOOD AND PRIMARY EDUCATION SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2025, national and local authorities have strengthened capacities to design, implement and scale up quality, gender responsive early childhood and primary education services., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence (Covid), Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, all boys and girls from conception to 10 years have access to and utilize quality integrated health, early childhood and education services and families are resilient and empowered to demand quality services in an inclusive care environment.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, national and local authorities have strengthened capacities to design, implement and scale up quality, gender responsiveearly childhood and primary education services.

description.narrative: The early childhood education has been strengthened by the drafting of a Law on Early Childhood Education (ECE), which sets the foundation for the expansion of quality and inclusive ECE and will be considered by Parliament in early 2022. The quality of ECE provision for the most vulnerable children has increased through infrastructure and early learning environment improvement in 16 community-based Early Childhood Development Centers and through the 1,200 activities for children which were made available through technical support from UNICEF on the digital early childhood development platform to support distance and family-based early education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022
